about.title: About Taxero
about.subtitle: A digital Swiss tax service developed by A&G Fiduciaire Sàrl to make your tax declarations simpler, clearer, and more secure.

company.title: Who we are
company.text1: Taxero is an online service dedicated to helping individuals and entrepreneurs file their Swiss tax declarations with confidence. Behind the platform stands A&G Fiduciaire Sàrl, a Swiss fiduciary firm with experience in taxation, accounting and advisory services.
company.text2: By combining human expertise with a secure digital platform, we offer a service that is both efficient and personal – adapted to your situation, your canton and your preferred language.

mission.title: Our mission
mission.text: Our mission is to simplify the Swiss tax declaration process. We want to remove complexity, avoid unpleasant surprises and save you time. With Taxero, you answer a clear and structured questionnaire, upload your documents securely, and our team takes care of preparing, reviewing and filing your declaration with the tax office.

general.title: General information
general.description: A quick overview of what Taxero is and who it is for.

q1.question: What is Taxero?
q1.answer: Taxero is an online service operated by A&G Fiduciaire Sàrl that helps you prepare and file your Swiss tax declaration. You answer a structured questionnaire, upload your documents securely, and our team prepares and submits your declaration to the tax authorities.

q2.question: Who can use Taxero?
q2.answer: The service is designed primarily for individuals who are tax resident in Switzerland. Depending on the canton and your situation, self-employed persons and small business owners may also be eligible. Specific information will be provided in the questionnaire and on our public website.

q3.question: Is the service fully online?
q3.answer: Yes. The entire process – from your initial request to the submission of your declaration – takes place online. However, you can still contact our team if you need assistance or prefer to clarify certain points with a human advisor.

process.title: Tax declaration process
process.description: How the different stages of the tax declaration work with Taxero.

q1.question: How does the tax declaration process work?
q1.answer: You start by filling in the online questionnaire and choosing an offer. Then you upload your documents. Our team reviews your file, prepares your tax declaration and sends you a draft for review. Once you approve it, we submit the declaration to the competent tax authority.

q2.question: How long does the process usually take?
q2.answer: The timelines depend on your situation and how quickly we receive all required documents. As a general rule, document review and preparation may take between 1 and 3 weeks once your file is complete. For urgent cases, please contact us as early as possible.

q3.question: Can I follow the progress of my declaration?
q3.answer: Yes. In your dashboard, each declaration is displayed with five clear stages – from document upload to submission. You can see the current step, an indicative time frame and a short status message for each stage.

documents.title: Required documents
documents.description: What documents you should prepare and upload for your Swiss tax declaration.

q1.question: Which documents do I need to provide?
q1.answer: The list of documents depends on your situation, but typically includes salary certificates, pension or AVS/LPP statements, bank statements, 3rd pillar certificates, information about real estate and any other income or deductions. The portal will show you a personalised list based on your answers.

q2.question: How do I upload my documents?
q2.answer: You can upload your documents directly in your client area in PDF format, following the instructions given for each document category. You can save your progress and come back later if you don’t have everything at once.

q3.question: What if I am missing a document?
q3.answer: If a document is temporarily missing, you can indicate it in the portal and upload it later. Our team may contact you with complementary questions or to suggest alternatives if certain information is not available.

payment.title: Payment and invoicing
payment.description: Information about pricing, payment methods and invoices.

q1.question: How is the service priced?
q1.answer: The price depends on your situation and the complexity of your tax declaration. When you complete the questionnaire, our price calculator suggests the most suitable offers for your profile, with clear and transparent fees.

q2.question: When and how do I pay?
q2.answer: You receive an invoice by email once your request is confirmed. The invoice is also available in your client area. Payment is usually made via bank transfer or the payment methods indicated on the invoice.

q3.question: Will I receive an invoice for my records?
q3.answer: Yes. An invoice in PDF format is generated automatically and can be downloaded at any time from your client area. It is issued by A&G Fiduciaire Sàrl for the Taxero service.

security.title: Security and confidentiality
security.description: How we protect your personal and tax data.

q1.question: How is my data protected?
q1.answer: We use secure connections (encrypted communication), controlled access and internal processes designed to protect your personal data. Only authorised team members can access your file in order to process your declaration.

q2.question: Where is my data stored?
q2.answer: As a rule, data is hosted in Switzerland and with providers that respect Swiss standards in terms of security and data protection. More details about data hosting are available in our privacy policy.

q3.question: Will my information be shared with third parties?
q3.answer: Your data is only shared with third parties when it is necessary for the execution of the mandate, for example with the relevant tax administration. We do not sell your personal data. All details are specified in our terms of use and privacy policy.
